00018 #include <algorithm>
00019 #include "topology.h"
00020 #include "exclusionlist.h"

00024 void ExclusionList::Clear(void)
00025 {
00026     list< exclusion_t *>::iterator iter;
00027     
00028     for(iter=_exclusions.begin();iter!=_exclusions.end();++iter)
00029         delete *iter;    
00030     _exclusions.clear(); 
00031 }
00032 
00033 void ExclusionList::ExcludeAll(int N)
00034 {
00035     Clear();
00036     for(int i=0; i<N-1; i++) {
00037         exclusion_t *e = new exclusion_t;
00038         e->_atom = i;
00039         for(int j=i+1; j<N; j++) {
00040             e->_exclude.push_back(j);
00041         }
00042         _exclusions.push_back(e);
00043     }
00044 }
00045 
00046 void ExclusionList::Remove(list<int> l)
00047 {
00048     l.sort();
00049     list<int>::iterator i, j;
00050     list<exclusion_t*>::iterator ex;
00051     
00052     for(i=l.begin(); i!=l.end(); i++) {
00053         for(ex=_exclusions.begin(); ex!=_exclusions.end(); ++ex)
00054             if((*ex)->_atom == *i) break;
00055         if(ex==_exclusions.end()) continue;
00056         j = i;        
00057         for(++j; j!=l.end(); j++)
00058             (*ex)->_exclude.remove(*j);
00059         
00060         if((*ex)->_exclude.empty()) {
00061         //    delete *ex;
00062             (*ex)=NULL;
00063             _exclusions.erase(ex);
00064         }
00065     }
00066     _exclusions.remove(NULL);
00067 }
00068 
00069 void ExclusionList::ExcludeList( list<int> l ) {
00070     l.sort();
00071     list<int>::iterator i, j, k;
00072     list<exclusion_t*>::iterator ex;
00073     
00074     for ( i = l.begin(); i != l.end(); ++i ) {
00075         for (ex = _exclusions.begin(); ex != _exclusions.end(); ++ex)
00076             if ( (*ex)->_atom == (*i) ) break;
00077         if (ex==_exclusions.end()) { // so far there are no exclusions for i
00078             exclusion_t *e = new exclusion_t;
00079             e->_atom = (*i);
00080             
00081             j = i;
00082             for (++j; j != l.end(); ++j)
00083                 e->_exclude.push_back( (*j) );
00084             _exclusions.push_back(e);
00085               
00086         }
00087         else {
00088             // there are some exclusions for i already. Add new exclusions if they are 
00089             // not there yet!
00090             j = i;
00091             for (++j; j != l.end(); ++j) {
00092                 
00093                 for ( k = (*ex)->_exclude.begin(); k != (*ex)->_exclude.end(); ++k ) 
00094                     if ( (*j) == (*k) ) break;
00095                 if ( k == (*ex)->_exclude.end() ) (*ex)->_exclude.push_back( (*j) );
00096             }
00097             
00098         }
00099     }
00100     
00101 }
00102     
00103 void ExclusionList::CreateExclusions(Topology *top) {
00104     
00105     InteractionContainer &ic = top->BondedInteractions();
00106     InteractionContainer::iterator ia;
00107     list<int> l;
00108     
00109     for (ia = ic.begin(); ia != ic.end(); ++ia) {
00110         int beads_in_int = (*ia)->BeadCount();
00111         l.clear();
00112         
00113         for (int ibead = 0; ibead < beads_in_int; ibead ++) {
00114             int ii = (*ia)->getBeadId(ibead);
00115             l.push_back(ii);
00116         }
00117         ExcludeList(l);  
00118     }
00119     // Create map
00120     list< exclusion_t * >::iterator it;
00121     for ( it = _exclusions.begin(); it != _exclusions.end(); ++it ) {
00122         int iatom = (*it)->_atom;
00123         _excl_by_bead[ iatom ] = (*it);
00124     }
00125     
00126 }
00127 
00128 bool ExclusionList::IsExcluded(int bead1, int bead2) {
00129     exclusion_t *excl;
00130     if (bead2 < bead1) swap(bead1, bead2);
00131     if ((excl = GetExclusions(bead1))) {
00132         if(find(excl->_exclude.begin(), excl->_exclude.end(), bead2) 
00133                 != excl->_exclude.end()) return true;        
00134     }
00135     return false;
00136 }
00137 
00138 std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &out, ExclusionList& exl)
00139 {
00140     list<ExclusionList::exclusion_t*>::iterator ex;
00141     
00142     for(ex=exl._exclusions.begin();ex!=exl._exclusions.end();++ex) {
00143         list<int>::iterator i;
00144         out << (int)((*ex)->_atom) + 1;
00145         for(i=(*ex)->_exclude.begin(); i!=(*ex)->_exclude.end(); ++i) {
00146             out << " " << ((*i)+1);
00147         }
00148         out << endl;
00149     }
00150     return out;
00151 }
00152 
00153 void ExclusionList::InsertExclusion(int index, list<int> l) {
00154 
00155     list<int>::iterator i;
00156 
00157     //cout << "atom " << index << endl;
00158     for(i=l.begin(); i!=l.end(); ++i) {
00159         int bead1 = index;
00160         int bead2 = *i;
00161         if (bead2 < bead1) swap(bead1, bead2);
00162         if(bead1==bead2) continue;
00163         if(IsExcluded(bead1, bead2)) continue;
00164         exclusion_t *e;
00165         if((e = GetExclusions(bead1)) == NULL) {
00166             e = new exclusion_t;
00167             e->_atom = bead1;
00168             _exclusions.push_back(e);
00169             _excl_by_bead[ bead1 ] = e;
00170         }
00171         e->_exclude.push_back(bead2);
00172         //cout << (*i) << " " << endl;
00173     }
00174     //cout << endl;
00175 }
